SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.app_manager.model.manager

Class AppList

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.app_manager.model.manager.AppList
public class AppList extends Object
The AppList class manages a list of applications. It allows for adding, retrieving, and deleting applications, as well as executing commands that update the state of the applications. The class also provides methods for filtering applications by type or ID.
Author:
Priyanshu Dongre

  • Constructor Details

    • AppList

      public AppList()
      Constructs an instance of the AppList class. Initializes the counter to 0 and creates an empty ArrayList to hold application objects.

  • Method Details

    • addApp

      public int addApp(Application.AppType appType, String summary, String note)
      Adds a new application to the list.
      Parameters:
      appType - the type of the application (e.g., NEW, OLD, HIRED).
      summary - a brief summary of the application.
      note - any additional notes for the application.
      Returns:
      the ID of the newly added application.

    • addApps

      public void addApps(List<Application> list)
      Adds a list of applications to the existing application list.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of applications to add.

    • getApps

      public List<Application> getApps()
      Returns a list of applications filtered by the specified type.
      Returns:
      a list of Application objects of the given type.

    • getAppsByType

      public List<Application> getAppsByType(String type)
      Returns a list of applications filtered by the specified type.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of applications to return (e.g., NEW, OLD).
      Returns:
      a list of Application objects of the given type.

    • getAppById

      public Application getAppById(int id)
      Retrieves an application by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Application object with the given ID, or null if not found.

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(int id, Command command)
      Executes a command on the application with the given ID. The command updates the application's state.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to update.
      command - the command to execute on the application.

    • deleteAppById

      public void deleteAppById(int id)
      Deletes an application by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the application to delete.
